text: I'm really proud to be the first Brit
going to the space station I've got into
aviation at very early age now has
really focus on that and passionate
about it but I'd never imagined at all
that I'd be here weeks away from a
launch into space I decided to be an
army helicopter pilot had a career for
18 years in the Army Air Corps ground
control to Major Tom
have you been preparing a David Bowie
cover we've seen astronauts give us
songs give us dances what have you got
up your sleeve Tim I'm not going to be
playing the guitar and singing that
that's one thing for sure I ended up
being a helicopter instructor and then a
test pilot and then working for a
crystal Westlands as a test pilot as
well
I saw the advert and realised that I was
at the right age I had the
qualifications the agency was looking
for was too good an opportunity not to
apply I'm extremely grateful obviously
to be selected to become an astronaut
for myself is absolutely a pinnacle of
my career six months deployment is it's
not that long I know it sounds like a
long time but it's something that many
military people are very used to
